Post Description:
During the Covid-19 circuit breaker last year, migrant workers were not allowed to leave their dormitories, not even to get food.

After learning about their predicament, Mrs Cherie Tseng and her husband Tseng Wun Hsiung rang up friends and relatives for donations, looked for catering firms, as well as Grab drivers to deliver food.

In 2 weeks, they raised more than $100,000 to provide over 10,000 meals to about 670 workers. The funds also went towards topping up SIM cards for 1,500 workers.

Full story in bio @straits_times
📸: Yong Li Xuan
#StraitsTimes #Singapore #MigrantWorkers #Covid19 #Coronavirus
Comments: Bless you both for your kind deeds
